page.title: 20ATTITUDES
page.content:
{"ON SATURDAY" by Paul Hartley (aged 9)
There is no school on a Saturday so I get up at about 9.15 a.m. I have my breakfast which is usually "Special 'K'" and get ready for football practice with Cubs. We reach Storth Playing Fields at about 10.00 and pick two teams. At half-time we have either coffe, tea or orange juice. When football is over I go home and have a bath. At 2.00 my mother takes Simon, my older brother, and me to the swimming baths at Carnforth High School so that I can train. At 4.15 I get out and Simon begins to train until 5.30. At 6.00 we get home again and watch television until tea is ready to eat. Then we watch television again until it is time to go to bed at 9.30 p.m.
